question: Read the passage below and choose the most appropriate transition word or phrase to fill in the blank.
text: In Great Expectations, Charles Dickens presents the story of Pip, a young orphan who comes into wealth unexpectedly. As Pip grows older, he becomes ashamed of his humble origins and strives to become a gentleman. _____ he gains wealth and social status, Pip learns that true happiness cannot be bought and that love and loyalty are more valuable than material possessions.
explanation:
Correct choice C: Even Though
The correct answer, "Even though," conveys the contrast between Pip’s initial hopes that wealth and status will bring him happiness and the eventual realization that material wealth cannot buy true happiness. "Even though" sets up the contrast between Pip’s initial expectations and his eventual understanding.
A) Although could work, but "Even though" emphasizes a stronger contrast and better fits the sentence's tone.
B) Because would imply causality, but the sentence is contrasting two ideas (wealth and happiness), not showing a cause-and-effect relationship.
D) In spite of would be incorrect because it doesn’t quite fit the logical structure of the sentence. "Even though" more directly highlights the contrast between Pip's expectations and the reality he learns.
